e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:27): robert_: undo the userdir line you put in httpd.conf
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:27): the file you want to change is extra/httpd-userdir.conf
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:27): and you want to uncomment the Include httpd-userdir.conf line
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:27): in your apache config file
7c009443eff8a1d05d177e5eef3f80f8 (02:28): er, I kinda misspoke- it was in default-server.conf
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:28): robert_: actually you don't really want to edit anything in httpd-userdir.conf
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:28): just uncomment the include httpd-userdir.conf line in your apache config
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:29): then for your user, create a public_html folder in his/her home directory
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:29): robert_: substitute user with the real system username
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (02:30): robert_: put that user's web content in public_html and test in browser with http://localhost/~user
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:31): client denied by server configuration?

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:31): Access was denied by a deny directive or if you changed the DocumentRoot, also change a <Directory > Block from the old root, to the new one. or you need a <Directory> or <Location> block for every Alias
